cred/Badge.title: Badge
cred/Badge.description:
A badge is a credential description, presented in the redeemer.

 Badges must match the different scope owner credentials.
 For example, when the owner is a ScriptCred,
 the presented credential must be a ScriptWithdrawal.

 Unique tokens can be presented as credentials.
 In such cases, we must check that the payment cred of the address
 owning the token is actually exercised:
  - either by a key in the required signatures
  - or by a script withdrawal

cred/ScopeOwnerCred.title: ScopeOwnerCred
cred/ScopeOwnerCred.description:
Credential of one scope owner.

 Using a unique token as credential is the most versatile approach,
 as it allows for more flexibility in managing ownership,
 and prevents the need to change the treasury address when
 transferring ownership of one scope.

treasury/BudgetConfig.title: BudgetConfig
treasury/BudgetConfig.description:
Budget configuration for each token.
 For example, the config for Ada, or for USDM.

 For each token, the budget config specifies the rolling net limit amount and duration.
 It also keeps track of recent withdrawals to enforce the rolling net limit.

treasury/Scope.title: Scope
treasury/Scope.description: One scope of the multi-tenant treasury

treasury/Withdrawal.title: Withdrawal
treasury/Withdrawal.description:
One withdrawal from the treasury.
 It contains the amount withdrawn and when it happened (within a range).
